concept.title: Concept Topics
concept.shortdesc: Concept topics introduce and explain subjects, providing background knowledge before procedural or reference content.

section.title: Use
section.p: Concept topics are used to introduce and explain a subject, tool, feature, or process. They provide background knowledge that users need before performing a task or understanding a reference. They are ideal for overviews, product introductions, or clarifying abstract ideas. Concept topics are especially important early in the user journey, explaining "why" something matters before showing "how" to use it.

section.title: User Intent
section.p: "I need to understand this before I can do anything with it."

ul.li: Start with a clear definition or overview.
Use analogies and examples for complex concepts.
Avoid embedding task steps within concept explanations; instead, link to separate task topics.

section.title: Sample XML Code
section.pre:
What is Two-Factor Authentication? Two-factor authentication (2FA) adds an extra layer of security.

2FA requires users to provide two forms of identity verification...

Benefits of 2FA

It protects against phishing, stolen passwords, and more.
